channel.title: The Headcrab Thread!
channel.description:
It's riddiculous having to create a trhead just for this but...
I think there should be a headcrab jumping at the player at the 7 minutes and 40 seconds of this video : ([url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A7ZPDoU1X_U&feature=relmfu[/url]). The headcrab would be sitting there in the elevator waiting for Gordon to appear.
[I'll take this trhead as an opportunity to say that you guys should insert more 'scary headcrab that i did not see coming out of nowhere, omg I almost sh*t my pants' moments. Because those are awesome. (And you've missed a lot of opportunities to insert moments like these into your game) ]

item.title: The Headcrab Thread!
item.dc:creator: Problematic_A-hole
item.description:
dearnike:

So then I was wandering around the console and found this
sv_headcrab_can_latch_on_player
Its set to 0. BM originally have a feature to get a headcrab in yer head?

yes

item.title: The Headcrab Thread!
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
The headcrabs move really weird just like they did in the original Half-life. I’m sure this animation problem was fixed in Half-Life Source but I’m not sure might have to try it out later and see.

Looks like I was right I fired up Half-Life source just see if they fixed that problem and they did.

Read full topic

item.title: The Headcrab Thread!
item.dc:creator: Vinylshadow
item.description:
Comrade Tiki:

I like! :3

I wonder if it’s possible to not kill any bullsquids… There’d be lots of strafing from the spit… I shall call it: Dance Dance Evolution.

Strafe (Right) Strafe (Left) Xenolution?

item.title: The Headcrab Thread!
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

Did anyone have any issues with the headcrabs on the lift? There were several challenges and preferences surrounding that bit so I am wondering what folks thought of it.

In my first playthrough, I tried to surf down the elevator shaft to see if I could make it safely… but the bottom was certain-death.

On my reload, I went to do the same thing but stopped short of jumping. I rode in front of the railing, crouching, and they all overshot me. It was hilarious. (I rode the front so I could keep my eye open for any hidden areas full of extra resources~ and was very pleased with what I found… that map is awesome)

Read full topic

item.title: The Headcrab Thread!
item.dc:creator: Vinylshadow
item.description:
TCMOREIRA:

It may sound stupid but vents are actually an important part of the gameplay aspect of Half Life. No wonder why they were kept in the Half Life 2 games. I bet at least 12% of the game is spent/is about Gordon Freeman crawling through vents.
So dark vents are the most immersive and special between all the vents in the game. Darker vents with headcrabs are a must. Gordon has to use that flashlight for some reason at some point at the game anyway. ;D

I never turn it off

Black Mesa is so dark…

Read full topic

item.title: The Headcrab Thread!
item.dc:creator: Cheerios
item.description:
I would have preferred more headcrap in the vents.

Read full topic

item.title: The Headcrab Thread!
item.dc:creator: haymaker
item.description:
Comrade Tiki:

edit: Wat da fudge:[indent]“Downgrade your GPU drivers to at least 28x.xx version, it is a nVIDIA bug affecting 7xxx series GPUs.”[/indent]Forgive me if I’m uneager to comply with that ‘fix’. My card is a 6800, though, and not 7xxx series.

Can’t hurt to try with proper sytem restore/regedit backup procedures, can it?

Failing that, you could bind your F key to “sv_cheats 1; mat_fullbright 1” as a hackaround…vents aren’t all that dramatic or immersive anyway

Read full topic

item.title: The Headcrab Thread!
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
I don’t dislike ventcrabs so long as they’re near one of those red ventbulbs.

sersoft:

there is a way to fix that, I remember this issue was reported here on the day after the mod’s release

Thanks, I’ll do some searches for it-- I was afraid that if I asked for assistance on such an issue, I would get yelled at and told to update my drivers (despite every other game running fine).

edit: Wat da fudge:[indent]“Downgrade your GPU drivers to at least 28x.xx version, it is a nVIDIA bug affecting 7xxx series GPUs.”[/indent]Forgive me if I’m uneager to comply with that ‘fix’. My card is a 6800, though, and not 7xxx series.

Read full topic

item.title: The Headcrab Thread!
item.dc:creator: TCMOREIRA
item.description:
Comrade Tiki:

I would like to take this moment to thank the team for not filling vents with headcrabs.

For some reason, my flashlight doesn’t work on 95% of models/surfaces, and many of Black Mesa’s vents are pitch black. In vents, I am required to crawl forward until I can no longer hear footsteps, then guess whether I should strafe left or right. (Among the very limited things my flashlight illuminates are a few metal doors and the explosive boxes.)

So, basically, thanks for not putting headcrabs in pitch-black areas. That’d really screw me over. I’m cool with low-lit ambushes, though, like the OP suggests.

I disagree. Headcrabs in vents are great. More is better.

Read full topic

item.title: The Headcrab Thread!
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
there is a way to fix that, I remember this issue was reported here on the day after the mod’s release

Read full topic

item.title: The Headcrab Thread!
item.dc:creator: TheOneAndOnly
item.description:
We need more headcrabs wearing Mexican hats, I think. ¡Caramba Gordon! ¿Quiere un taco? (we all know Mexico = tacos, and you know, New Mexico…)

I agree with the idea of more headcrabs though. They’re quite iconic!

item.title: The Headcrab Thread!
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
I hope you weren’t aiming to break the grammar thing.

I think the fact that the elevator falls is good enough, what with it being a transition. When I played I didn’t expect it, just, “Oh, look a battery. Wait, no, I’m not out!”

Read full topic
